lines.text: Wayne! Listen, we need to have a talk about Vanderhoff. The fact is he's the sponsor and you signed a contract guaranteeing him certain concessions, one of them being a spot on the show.

[holding a Pizza Hut box]
Well that's where I see things just a little differently. Contract or no, I will not bow to any sponsor.
I'm sorry you feel that way, but basically it's the nature of the beast.

[holding a bag of Doritos]
Maybe I'm wrong on this one, but for me, the beast doesn't include selling out. Garth, you know what I'm talking about, right?

[wearing Reebok wardrobe]
It's like people only do these things because they can get paid. And that's just really sad.
I can't talk about it anymore; it's giving me a headache.
Here, take two of these!
[Dumps two Nuprin pills into Wayne's hand]
Ah, Nuprin. Little. Yellow. Different.
Look, you can stay here in the big leagues and play by the rules, or you can go back to the farm club in Aurora. It's your choice.

[holding a can of Pepsi]
Yes, and it's the choice of a new generation.
No Stairway. Denied!
Well, don't you want to open your present?
If it's a severed head, I'm going to be very upset.
Open it.
What is it?
It's a gun rack.
A gun rack... a gun rack. I don't even own *a* gun, let alone many guns that would necessitate an entire rack. What am I gonna do with a gun rack?
You don't like it? Fine. You know Wayne, if you're not careful, you're going to lose me.
I lost you two months ago. Are you mental? We broke up. Get the net!
Happy anniversary, Wayne.
Stacy, we broke up two months ago.
Well, that doesn't mean we can't still go out, does it?
Well, it does actually, that's what breaking up is.
So, do you come to Milwaukee often?

Well, I'm a regular visitor here, but Milwaukee has certainly had its share of visitors. The French missionaries and explorers were coming here as early as the late 1600s to trade with the Native Americans.
In fact, isn't "Milwaukee" an Indian name?
Yes, Pete, it is. Actually, it's pronounced "mill-e-wah-que" which is Algonquin for "the good land."
I was not aware of that.
Am I supposed to be a man? Am I supposed to say, "It's OK, I don't mind, I don't mind"? Well, I mind! I mind big time! And you know what the worst part is? I NEVER LEARNED TO READ.
Is that true?
Yes, everything except the reading part.
Benjamin is nobody's friend. If Benjamin were an ice cream flavor, he'd be pralines and dick.
[Wayne and Garth are lying on the hood of the mirth-mobile, staring at the starlit sky]
Sometimes I wish I could boldly go where no man has gone before... but I'll probably stay in Aurora. What are you thinking about?
Cassandra. She's a fox. In French, she would be called "la renarde" and she would be hunted with only her cunning to protect her.
She's a babe.
She's a robo-babe. In Latin, she would be called "babia majora".
If she were a president, she would be Baberham Lincoln.
[a brief pause]
Did you ever find Bugs Bunny attractive when he put on a dress and played a girl bunny?
No.
[cracks up laughing]
No.
Neither did I. I was just asking.
[Instead of saying "Excuse me, I beg your pardon?"]
Ex-squeeze me? Baking powder?
Or, imagine being magically whisked away to... Delaware.
[pauses]
Hi. I'm in... Delaware.

[to the camera]
I'd never done a crazy thing in my life before that night. Why is it that if a man kills another man in battle, it's called heroic, yet if he kills a man in the heat of passion, it's called murder?
Hel-lo! What do you think you're doing? Only me and Garth get to talk to the camera.

[to an old man in the neighboring car at a red light]
Pardon me, do you have any Grey Poupon?
Garth, marriage is punishment for shoplifting in some countries.
Wayne. How you doin'?
Hey, Tiny, who's playing today?
Jolly Green Giants and the Shitty Beetles.
Shitty Beetles? Are they any good?
They suck.
Then it's not just a clever name.
[Garth plays an astonishing drum solo in the music store]
You are like... amazing... dude.
Thanks. I like to play.

Well, that's all the time we had for our movie. We hope you found it entertaining, whimsical and yet relevant, with an underlying revisionist conceit that belied the films emotional attachments to the subject matter.
I just hoped you didn't think it sucked.
Uhm, Wayne? What do you do if every time you see this one incredible woman, you think you're gonna hurl?
I say hurl. If you blow chunks and she comes back, she's yours. But if you spew and she bolts, then it was never meant to be.
[Talking about Claudia Schiffer]
She's a babe.
She's magically babelicious.
She tested very high on the stroke-ability scale.

OK... First I'll access the secret military spy satellite that's in a geosynchronous orbit over the Midwest. Then, I'll ID the limo by the vanity plate "MR. BIGGG" and get his approximate position. Then, I'll reposition the transmitter dish on the remote truck to 17.32 degrees east, hit WESTAR 4 over the Atlantic, bounce the signal down into the Azores, up to COMSAT 6, beam it back to SATCOM 2 transmitter number 137, and down on the dish on the back of Mr. Big's limo... It's almost too easy.
I once thought I had mono for an entire year. It turned out I was just really bored.
Ribbed for her pleasure. Ewww.
It will be Terry's job to give the actors their hand cue.
Excuse me, Russel, but I believe I requested the hand job...
Hey Mr. Donut Man, who's trying to kill ya? I don't know but they better not!
All I have to say about that is "asphinctersayswhat".
What?
Exactly.
Do I frighten you?
No.
Do you want me to?
[admiring a guitar in a music store]
It will be mine. Oh yes. It will be mine.
Anything wrong, Davy?
Yeah, I got paid today.
Yeah, I know what that's like.
No. You don't understand. They laid me off. I got one of these.
Yeah, I know how that feels.
Know what I'd like to do?
Yeah I know what you'd like to do. You'd like to find the guy who did it, rip his still beating heart out of his chest and hold it in front of his face so he can see how black it is before he dies.
Actually, I was thinking of filing a grievance with the union.
Well, the world's a twisted place.
[Wayne Campbell is stopped by a traffic cop]
Yes, officer, is there a problem?
Have you seen this boy?
[Holding Claudia Schiffer picture]
Hey, are you done yet? I'm getting tired of holding it.
Yeah, that's what she said.
Purchase feeble public access cable show and exploit it." Gee, I feel sorry for whoever *that* is.

[getting a suck-cut]
Aaaahh! Turn it off man, turn it off! It's sucking my will to live! Oh, the humanity!
[Wayne opens a door to show a bunch of spies in training]
What are you gonna do with these guys?
Oh, nothing really. I just always wanted to open a door to room where people are being trained like in James Bond movies.
You know, if you stab a man in the dead of winter, steam will rise up from the wounds. Indians believed it was his soul escaping from his body.
Uh, Wayne?
Yeah?
Do you ever get the feeling Benjamin's just using us?
Good call. It's like he wants us to be liked by everyone. I mean Led Zeppelin didn't write tunes everybody liked. They left that to the Bee Gees.
Russell's very excited you're coming down to the studio.
Oh, the studio. That's where the magic happens.
Oh, you've worked in television?
No, but I watch a lot of it.
Of course you do. You're creative.
She's the one who came up with the name "Noah's Arcade."
I just opened my mouth and out it came!
[They all laugh]
You're a lucky man, Mr. Vanderhoff.
Dick York, Dick Sargent, Sergeant York... Wow, that's weird.
[last lines]
I love you, Wayne.
I love you, Cassandra.
I love you, Garth.
I love you, dreamwoman.
You know, ever since I did your show, kids are looking at me in a whole new way.
I love you, man.
And I love you. Because I've learned that Platonic love *can* exist between two grown men.

And I've learned something, too. I've learned that a flawless profile, a perfect body, the right clothes, and a great car can get you far in America - almost to the top - but it can't get you everything.
Isn't it great that we're all better people?
[beat]
FISHED IN!
Wow! What a totally amazing, excellent discovery... NOT!
That bass player's a babe. She makes me feel kinda funny, like when we used to climb the rope in gym class.
does not live with parents.
you're a gimp. You know what you can do with your pop quiz?
Well, you know what you can do with your show? You can take a flying...
[a passing jet liner mutes out most of what he says]
...till the handle breaks off and you have to get a doctor to pull it out again!
You kiss your mother with that mouth?
I don't believe I've ever had French champagne before...

Oh, actually all champagne is French; it's named after the region. Otherwise it's sparkling white wine. Americans of course don't recognize the convention, so it becomes that thing of calling all of their sparkling white "champagne", even though by definition they're not.
The Next Generation". In many ways it's superior but will never be as recognized as the original.

[to Alice Cooper]
We're not worthy! We're not worthy!
We're scum!
We suck!
I know I don't have his looks. I know I don't have his money. I know I don't have his connections, his knowledge of fine wines. I know sometimes when I eat I get this clicking sound in my jaw...
[after being stranded]
I'm having a good time... *not*!

I have an extensive collection of name tags and hairnets. Ok, so I still live with my parents, which I admit is bogus and sad. However, I do have a cable access show, and I still know how to party. But what I'd really like is to do Wayne's World for a living. It might happen. Yeah, and monkeys might fly out of my butt.
Zang. ("excellent" in Cantonese)
[Ron Paxton demonstrates his new invention, the "suck kut"]
As you can see, it sucks as it cuts.
It certainly does suck.
Tell me, when the first show is over, will you still love me when I'm an incredibly humungoid giant star?
Yeah.
Will you still love me when I'm in my hanging-out-with-Ravi-Shankar phase?
Yeah.
Will you still love me when I'm in my carbohydrate, sequined-jumpsuit, young-girls-in-white-cotton-panties, waking-up-in-a-pool-of-your-own-vomit, bloated-purple-dead-on-a-toilet phase?
Yeah.
Okay, party. Bonus.
Hey, who wants Chinese take-out? I know a great place!
I'll have the "cream of sum yung guy".
First he screws me, then he screws you. It's Dutch door action.
[enjoying a breathtaking view]
You know, Cassandra, from this height... you could really hock a loogie on someone.

[next to a Cop]
I smell bacon. Does anyone else smell bacon?
I definitely smell a pork product of some kind.

Did you ever see that "Twilight Zone" where the guy signed a contract and they cut out his tongue and put it in a jar and it wouldn't die, it just grew and pulsated and gave birth to baby tongues? Pretty cool, huh?
[after seeing Cassandra for the first time]
She will be mine. Oh, yes - she will be mine.
First, let me get this out of the way - I'm a big fan.
You are?
The way I see it, your show is capable of so much more.
Well, we'll try harder, OK? Just give us a second chance. Just don't go and cancel us without giving us a second chance.
Wayne. Wayne. Garth told me about the show, man. I love you man.
Yeah, and I love you too, Terry.
No, no, no. I mean it man. I LOVE you.
No, I-I mean it. I love you.
No, you don't, man. I love you.

[being hugged by Terry]
Garth. Hey, come over here, I think Terry has something he wants to say to you.
I love you, man.
Thank you.
Let me tell you something about women, Wayne. They want you to come get them. They LOVE it.
So Garth, what do you think so far?
At first, it's constrictive, but after awhile it becomes a part of you.
[the Vanderhoffs give him an odd look]

[not remembering their trip to the Gasworks]
Hey, did you guys go to the Gasworks on Friday night?

[Referring to him and Phil as well]
Yeah, we were there.
There was this band, 'Crucial Taunt'. They had this mega-babe for a lead singer, unreal.
Phil, we were there. Have you gone mental? Hello!

[sees his car parked outside the house]
Ahh... the Mirth-Mobile...
Hi, Garth.
Hi.
I'm looking for Wayne. I'm very concerned about him; he seems to be going through a difficult phase right now, ya know. What do you think it is?
That you're mental.
You know him best, what do you think I should do?
Just get over it and go out with somebody else.
"Get over it go out with somebody else." Yeah, thanks, OK, great. Hi.
We fear change.
Kiss your mother with that mouth? I'm gettin' outta here, Damien!
Fine then, go!
I'm gone!
Go then!
But I am!
Go!
I'm Gone!
Go then!
But I am!

[playing street hockey with Wayne and blocking a goal]
Gretzky denied!
No way!
Way!
[Holds out a Dixie cup]
Hey Phil, if you're gonna spew, spew into this.
Have you spoken to Wayne about the Vanderhoff spot?
Yes, briefly. He was not very receptive.
Oh really? Well I'll explain it to him that it's not a choice. It's in his contract
Oh. Well Wayne will understand that right away... NOT!
[Ben glares at Russ]
Excuse me!

[after Ben orders Chinese food while speaking Cantonese]
This guy is good.
I picked up a little Cantonese while I was in the Orient. You know, you sound a lot like you're from Kowloon Bay as opposed to Hong Kong.
I was born in Kowloon Bay!
There you have it!
This guy is really good.
Do you have a lawyer?
Yes. Ahm, no. We're between lawyers right now. You see, our first lawyer screwed our affairs so bad.

That's right. I walked right to that office - that's what I did - and I reached across that desk and I grabbed him by his big fat head and I said "Listen, man. I'm not going to jail for *you* or for anybody."
[to the camera]
What the hell's going on? I lost my show, I lost my best friend, I lost my girl. I'm being shit on, that's all, shit on, and you know what really pisses me off-
[Camera pans away]
Wait, where are you goin'? OK, things aren't that great, but I'll get 'em back, OK?
Yeah, and if a frog had wings it wouldn't bump its ass when it hopped.
Interesting. Where did you learn English?
College... and the Police Academy movies.
Phil, what are you doing here? You're partied out, man. Again.
What if he honks in the car?
I'm giving you a no-honk guarantee.
[in a music store]
I know. I'll use the "May I help you?" riff.
[strums guitar]
May I help you?
We're looking down on Wayne's basement. Only that's not Wayne's basement. Isn't that weird?
Yeah, that's weird, man, that's weird. Garth! That was a haiku!
And I would've gotten away with it too, if it hadn't been for you snoopin' kids!

[admiring Benjamin's apartment]
Yep, this is definitely the kind of apartment I'll have if I ever move out of my parents' basement.
Come bust a move where the games are played, it's chill, it's fresh, it's Noah's Arcade.
[first lines]
[in bed, flipping through tv commercials]
It's really good seeing you, Benjamin. You haven't been into Shakey's for so long.
Well, I've been real busy.

[to camera]
Hey, why is this guy being so nice to us?
She's a babe! Schwing! Oddie-Oddie-Oddie-Oddie-Oddie! Uggghh!
